FAQ.question: Why is Book Type required to fetch Sale Deeds in Kerala?
FAQ.answer: Kerala maintains multiple registry books based on document category. Selecting the correct book ensures the document is searched in the right register.

FAQ.question: Does the Kerala Sale Deed include re-survey numbers or new survey references?
FAQ.answer: Yes, if updated at the time of registration. Older documents may require linking with resurvey records separately.

FAQ.question: Does the Sale Deed in Kerala mention building or flat details?
FAQ.answer: Yes, it can include apartment identifiers, floor numbers, and project information if recorded during registration.

FAQ.question: Can a Kerala Sale Deed include multiple adjoining plots?
FAQ.answer: Yes, multiple parcels may appear under one document if part of the same transaction and registration entry.

FAQ.question: Is Sale Deed sufficient for land update in Village or Local Body records?
FAQ.answer: No. After registration, mutation or Thandaper updates must be applied separately to update revenue records.

FAQ.question: Does the Kerala Sale Deed confirm encumbrance clearance?
FAQ.answer: Not fully. It records the specific transaction. Encumbrance must be verified through EC or title audit.

FAQ.question: Does the Sale Deed specify land use as per Kerala zoning laws?
FAQ.answer: It may mention usage, but zoning must be verified through local body or planning authority records.

FAQ.question: Is this document valid for bank loan processing?
FAQ.answer: Yes, along with EC, possession certificates, tax receipts, and other supporting records.

FAQ.question: Can ownership disputes be identified from the Sale Deed?
FAQ.answer: It shows registered transfers, but disputes must be checked through court records or legal audits.

FAQ.question: Is the Sale Deed downloaded from JaaGa authentic?
FAQ.answer: Yes. All data is sourced directly from official Kerala registration databases without modification.
